header.tagline: Recommends suitable fingering for the given notes
about.title: About
about.p1: Cello Fingering Assistant is a tool for designing optimal cello fingering. It analyses a sequence of notes and recommends the most suitable fingering with regard to position stability and minimising shifts.
about.p2: The algorithm prefers staying in one position, minimises shifts between positions, and favours lower positions. It supports enharmonic equivalents for correct handling of all scales. Output format (staff / text) is changed in Settings below the results.
features.title: Main features
features.algo.title: üéØ Smart algorithm
features.algo.desc: Advanced algorithm that optimises fingering with regard to position stability, minimising shifts and favouring lower positions.
features.staff.title: üéµ Staff and text output
features.staff.desc: Optional output: staff (bass clef, whole notes, positions above notes, fingers and note names as annotations, coloured strings) or text output (positions, fingers, notes). Toggle in Settings. Horizontal scroll on smaller screens.
features.fingerboard.title: üé® Visual fingerboard
features.fingerboard.desc: Realistic fingerboard visualisation with a black background (in both light and dark mode), showing the recommended fingering with coloured strings and hand-motion links. Proportional spacing between positions (smaller towards the bridge) matches real cello distances. Responsive with horizontal scroll.
features.tech.title: ‚öôÔ∏è Technical features
features.tech.desc: Light/dark theme (device setting or manual toggle in menu), multilingual (menu ‚Äì flags), H/B note naming in Settings. Test page for algorithm verification.
tones.title: Tones, fingers and positions
tones.intro: Position label conversion table: diatonic (I, II‚Üì, ‚Ä¶) vs chromatic (I‚ÄìXII, Roman numerals). The note is the tone on the A string with 1st finger in that position.
input.label: Enter notes with octave and accidentals, space-separated, e.g. C c c1 c1# gb
settings.title: ‚öôÔ∏è Settings
errors.outOfRange: Note out of range or unknown notation.
